result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander M Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
A payment plan for all monetary obligations is to be established by DOC, probation and parole.
All unpaid monetary obligations at the end of the payment time frame will convert to a civil judgment.
**If revoked:  25% of funds colected by DOC to go toward all Court ordered monetary obligations if revoked.
Obtain GED first, then obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.

No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distributing of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with victim Fannie C.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens if deemed appropriate.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander M Brooks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Ineligible Voting Notice And Acknowledgement, FILED.
Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief, FILED.

Attorney Kiley Zellner in court, defendant Alexander M Brooks not in court, in custody.  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-09-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alexander M Brooks in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Alexander M Brooks in custody. Timothy Cotter for Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defense requests that bail be amended down.  Arguments heard, Court denies.  Bail is NOT amended.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, no alcohol. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Fannie C. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alexander M Brooks in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Alexander M Brooks in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
